**The Law of Temporal Equivalent**: The rule that every person has an equal amount of time in their lives. This rule encourages people to value time and to use it wisely. It promotes the idea that everyone has the same 24 hours in a day and that we should make the most of the time we have.

**The Law of Gravity**: The rule that everyone should take responsibility for their actions and their consequences. This rule promotes accountability and personal responsibility. It encourages people to take ownership of their actions and to face the consequences of their choices.

**The Law of Reciprocity**: The rule that people should give as they would receive. This rule encourages people to be fair and to offer help or support to others in the same way that they would expect to receive it.

**The Law of the Circle**: The rule that everyone should support and uplift each other. This rule promotes a sense of community and encourages people to work together to achieve common goals. It encourages people to build each other up rather than tearing each other down.

**The Law of Compassion**: The rule that everyone should strive to understand and empathize with others. This rule encourages people to put themselves in the shoes of others and to show compassion and understanding in their interactions.
